benchmark_details.name: Human-related Anomaly Localization
benchmark_details.overview: The Human-related Anomaly Localization benchmark includes 12 types of human-related anomalous behaviors, including fighting, people falling, and robbery, with a total of 1,159 videos and 26.3 hours of footage.
benchmark_details.data_type: video with frame-level annotations and text descriptions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for few-shot temporal action localization focused on human-anomalous events.

data.source: Videos manually selected from MSAD, XD-Violence, and CUV A datasets.
data.annotation: Frame-level annotations of anomaly intervals, along with corresponding frame captions and logical chain text.

methodology.calculation: mAP calculated at an IoU threshold of 0.5 for evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP indicates better performance in accurately localizing actions within untrimmed videos.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved state-of-the-art performance on public benchmarks with an improvement of 4% on ActivityNet1.3 and 12% on THUMOS14.
methodology.validation: The method was validated through extensive experiments on public benchmarks.
